name: ArrowDL
description: ArrowDL (Arrow Downloader) is a download manager for Windows, MacOS and Linux
readme_summary: ArrowDL is a cross-platform download manager for Windows, MacOS, and Linux. It supports various download types, including standard files, torrents, and streaming content, and integrates with web browsers through extensions.
key_features: Web browser integration (Chrome, Firefox, Edge, Safari)
primary_use_case: Managing and accelerating downloads of various content types from the web.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled archer, representing ArrowDL, firing arrows (representing download requests) at a series of targets (representing different types of online content: videos, files, torrents). Each arrow hits its target, which then transforms into a neatly organized collection of downloaded data. The archer stands on a platform labeled 'Cross-Platform' with icons for Windows, MacOS, and Linux. Subtle UI elements float in the background, showing download progress bars and file management interfaces. The scene is set in a bright, modern digital landscape with a clean, focused composition and a blue and green color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details.

name: linera-protocol
description: Main repository for the Linera protocol
readme_summary: The Linera protocol repository provides the core infrastructure for building scalable and secure Web3 applications. It includes crates for base definitions, data storage, execution, chain management, RPC communication, client libraries, and an SDK for developing Linera applications in Rust for the Wasm virtual machine.
key_features: Version management for binaries and services
Data structure mapping onto key-value stores
Runtime and execution logic for Linera applications
Chain management for blocks, certificates, and cross-chain messaging
Core Linera protocol logic (client, server, node synchronization)
Client library for interacting with the Linera network
Executable for clients, proxy, and servers
SDK for developing Linera applications in Rust for Wasm
primary_use_case: Building highly scalable, secure, low-latency Web3 applications.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a series of interconnected gears, each representing a component of the Linera protocol, working in perfect synchronization to power a futuristic cityscape. The gears are made of polished metal and glow with a soft, internal light. Data streams flow between the gears, visualized as glowing threads. A central, larger gear represents the core protocol, driving the smaller gears around it. Small UI elements are subtly incorporated into the gears, showing data processing and network activity. The scene is set against a dark, starry background with a subtle blue and purple color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with intricate details and a sense of technological sophistication.

name: aassh
description: aassh is a lightweight command-line tool for managing SSH connections. It allows you to save, organize, and quickly connect to your SSH servers using convenient aliases instead of memorizing IP addresses and parameters.
readme_summary: aassh is a command-line tool designed to simplify SSH connection management. It allows users to save SSH connection details as named profiles, enabling quick and easy connections to servers without needing to remember IP addresses or complex commands.
key_features: Security: Designed to work with SSH keys
Fast Connection: Instant access to servers by name
Flexible Configuration: Easy editing of connection parameters
Easy Installation: Single script for installation and setup
primary_use_case: Managing and quickly connecting to SSH servers using aliases.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian meticulously organizing glowing server racks, each labeled with a clear, descriptive tag like 'Production' or 'Development'. The librarian uses a special cataloging tool that instantly connects them to the desired server with a simple voice command. Small UI elements float around the server racks, displaying connection parameters and status. The scene is set in a futuristic library with soft, ambient lighting. The repository name 'aassh' is subtly displayed on the librarian's tablet. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and a calming color scheme.

name: Configurator
description: Configurator: type-safe Haskell config parsing. Validates settings at compile time, preventing runtime errors. Uses Haskell's type system and Template Haskell for first-class configuration schema support.
readme_summary: Configurator is a Haskell library for type-safe configuration parsing. It validates application settings at compile time, preventing runtime errors related to configuration. The library leverages Haskell's type system and Template Haskell to treat configuration schemas as first-class citizens.
primary_use_case: Parsing and validating configuration files in Haskell applications.
cover_image_prompt: A master craftsman meticulously assembling a complex clockwork mechanism, where each gear represents a configuration setting. The craftsman uses a set of precisely calibrated tools (Haskell's type system) to ensure every gear fits perfectly. A blueprint with type signatures hovers nearby. The finished clock represents a robust, error-free application. Small screens display YAML and JSON code snippets. The scene is set in a brightly lit workshop with a clean, organized aesthetic. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and sharp details.

name: super-agent-party
description: ⭐零门槛的3D桌面伴侣！支持接入QQ、B站直播、RAG、联网、长期记忆、 酒馆角色卡、claude code 、浏览器控制、Dify、 Home Assistant、MCP、A2A、Comfyui、数字人口播等功能！⭐ A 3D desktop companion with zero barriers! Supports integration with QQ, Bilibili live, RAG, web search, long-term memory, sillyTavern Card, claude code, browser control, HA, Dify, MCP, A2A, ComfyUI,Digital Human broadcast,more!
readme_summary: Super-agent-party is a 3D AI desktop companion that allows users to enhance LLM APIs without code modification. It supports integration with various platforms like QQ, Bilibili, and tools like Home Assistant and ComfyUI, offering features such as knowledge base integration, real-time networking, and cross-platform capability aggregation.
primary_use_case: Creating and deploying intelligent agents to various platforms and integrating them with different tools and services.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly robot butler stands in a futuristic workshop, seamlessly connecting various devices and services with glowing cables. The butler uses a universal remote to control a smart home system, a live streaming setup, and a complex AI model represented by a brain-shaped server. Small UI elements on nearby screens show data flowing between these systems. The workshop is filled with tools and gadgets, subtly incorporating the repository name on a workbench. The scene is well-lit with a vibrant color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.
